citation.article-title: Thioreductor micantisoli gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel mesophilic, sulfur-reducing chemolithoautotroph within the epsilon-Proteobacteria isolated from hydrothermal sediments in the Mid-Okinawa Trough.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Thioreductor (Thi.o.re.duc′tor. Gr. n. thios sulfur; L. masc. n. reductor reducer; N.L. masc. n. Thioreductor sulfur-reducer).
Short rod, highly motile with a polar flagellum.
Able to utilize molecular hydrogen as an electron donor and elemental sulfur and nitrate as electron acceptors.
G+C content of the genomic DNA is about 35 mol%.
Major cellular fatty acids are C16 : 1, C16 : 0 and C18 : 1.
On the basis of 16S rRNA gene sequence analysis, the genus Thioreductor is distantly related to recognized genera within the ε-Proteobacteria.
The type species is Thioreductor micantisoli.
